018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.time.Instant;
021import java.util.Optional;
022import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
023import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
024
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.CONDITIONAL;
027import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
028
029
030/**
031 * Predicate to identify any identifiable resource within a filter expression.
032 * This predicates uses a unique identifier for an instance of a resource within
033 * the context of the service that is serving the resource.
034 *
035 * <h2>Versioning</h2>
036 * The {@link #getIdentifier() identifier} property is mandatory.
037 * Other properties can be used to navigate versions of a resource if an implementation supports versioning.
038 * If an implementation does not support versioning, any value specified for these attributes are ignored
039 * and the predicate always select the single version that is available.
040 *
041 * @author  Chris Dillard (SYS Technologies)
042 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
043 * @version 3.1
044 * @since   3.1
045 *
046 * @param  <R>  the type of resources (e.g. {@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}) to filter.
047 */
048@UML(identifier="SpatialOperator", specification=ISO_19143)
049public interface ResourceId<R> extends Filter<R> {
050    /**
051     * Returns the nature of this operator.
052     * The default implementation returns {@code RESOURCE_ID}.
053     *
054     * @return the nature of the operator.
055     */
056    @Override
057    default CodeList<?> getOperatorType() {
058        return FilterName.RESOURCE_ID;
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Specifies the identifier of the resource that shall be selected by the predicate.
063     * If the implementation supports versioning, this identifier is a system generated
064     * hash containing a logical resource identifier and a version number.
065     * The specific details of the hash are implementation dependent and is opaque to clients.
066     *
067     * @return the identifier of the resource that shall be selected by the predicate.
068     */
069    @UML(identifier="rid", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
070    String getIdentifier();
071
072    /**
073     * Specifies which version of the resource shall be selected.
074     * The version may be an integer indicating the <var>N</var><sup>th</sup> version,
075     * a date for selecting the version closest to the specified date,
076     * or an {@linkplain VersionAction action} such as {@code FIRST}, {@code LATEST},
077     * {@code PREVIOUS}, {@code NEXT} or {@code ALL}.
078     *
079     * @return version of the resource to select.
080     */
081    @UML(identifier="version", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
082    default Optional<Version> getVersion() {
083        return Optional.empty();
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Selects all versions of a resource between the specified start date and end date.
088     * The {@code startTime} and {@link #getEndTime() endTime} attributes shall always be specified together.
089     * If the {@code startTime} and {@code endTime} are specified, then the {@link #getVersion() version} attribute
090     * shall not be specified.
091     *
092     * @return start date and time of versions to select.
093     */
094    @UML(identifier="startTime", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
095    default Optional<Instant> getStartTime() {
096        return Optional.empty();
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Selects all versions of a resource between the specified start date and end date.
101     * The {@link #getStartTime() startTime} and {@code endTime} attributes shall always be specified together.
102     * If the {@code startTime} and {@code endTime} are specified, then the {@link #getVersion() version} attribute
103     * shall not be specified.
104     *
105     * @return end date and time of versions to select.
106     */
107    @UML(identifier="endTime", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
108    default Optional<Instant> getEndTime() {
109        return Optional.empty();
110    }
111}
